listing.listing_description: Enter a tranquil seaside villa with excellent facilities and diverse touches of world culture. Located on Brač’s quiet eastern shore, guests can lounge by this home’s vivid infinity pool, relax in plush, modern interiors, and slumber in comfortable bedrooms with balcony views of sailboats in the port below. The lively village of Sumartin, hidden beaches, hikes and museums are a short drive away.A stay at Villa Mila is enriched by the scenic location, sumptuous nature of the home, and special decor touches. Palm trees reach towards the sun on the viewpoint terrace, while urban chic is evident in the hanging seats and slick exterior furniture. Asian-inspired sculptures populate the spacious bathrooms, while distinct design that recalls maritime Mediterranean culture runs through the softly-outfitted bedrooms. The smooth, concealed fixtures of the kitchen give an impression of effortless modernity, with the large, chandelier-lit dining table accommodating large groups with aplomb. Villa Mila is ideally located for making the most of Brač, one of the most popular islands of the Dalmatian coast. The quiet lanes and port restaurants of Sumartin village are close by, with a coast drive revealing strikingly blue water and sandy beaches. Guests can visit small wineries and roadside cafes, which offer exceptional local cheeses, olive oil and meats every few kilometres. Visit fascinating memorials, take to the gentle water with supplied kayaks, or hike through serene valleys to explore a centuries-old monastery. After an active day, a relaxing evening shooting pool or sipping a drink outdoors is ideal.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Tap into the vibrant scene of the Algarve at Villa Hibiscus Beach House. Set along the golden stretch of the Praia de Galé beach, this property is one of the few vacation rentals in the area to offer the luxury of an oceanfront location. Reserve its four bedrooms and chic, colorful interiors for a sunny stay with friends or a relaxed holiday with up to eight of your closest family.Watch the waves from a private terrace with a heated pool, plenty of loungers, a barbecue and an al-fresco dining area. In the evenings, relax in front of the fireplace or TV, or catch up with friends at home via Wi-Fi. The villa is also air conditioned and has laundry facilities for your convenience.Pieces from around the globe give the villa’s interiors eclectic appeal. The open-concept living and dining room features everything from breezy wicker seating and batik prints to hand-carved Buddhas. The separate kitchen is fully equipped and has a stylish breakfast table painted in bright turquoise for an extra morning pick-me-up.Villa Hibiscus Beach House has four bedrooms with king beds, en-suite bathrooms and TVs, including a master suite that opens directly to the pool area. For larger parties or families traveling with children, there’s a fifth bedroom with two twin beds and an en-suite bathroom. Like the great room, the bedrooms are decorated in a bold, brilliant mix of colors and patterns.From the villa’s location in central Algarve, it’s a short drive to several beaches—and a short walk to the honeymoon-worthy one just in front. Find local shops, restaurants, bars and more in downtown Albufeira and Guia, or take a quiet stroll or bike ride through the nearby Salgado nature reserve. History buffs will want to take a day trip to Silves Castle.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: From its prestigious ski-in/ski-out location the Chamonix Valley, Chalet Castor enjoys instant access to the ski slopes, as well as incredible views of the Mont Blanc and Fiz mountain ranges. With four luxurious bedroom and accommodations for ten, Castor is the perfect host for an unforgettable French Alps ski vacation. Not only will you have quick and easy access to some of the best skiing on the planet, but the legendary vibrant nightlife of Chamonix is also just ten minutes from home.Castor’s stone roof is quite the sight in the French Alps. Usually more associated with the Italian style, the stone roof makes this villa stand out, even in an area as prestigious as Chamonix. Inside, the decor is all about wood and stone, warmth and comfort, and mountain views. You’ll love the stylish updates provided by state of the art electronics and appliances. The designer furnishings make Castor even more comfortable. And, the second living room and bunk beds are perfect if you’re traveling with kids.Chalet Castor is ideal for hosting unforgettable family dinners with its formal dining area for twelve and fully equipped kitchen, with wine fridge and breakfast bar. After dinner, gather in the living room for a movie night, while lounging next to a roaring fire. You’ll also appreciate Castor’s Wi-Fi, heated floors, satellite television, and rejuvenating steam room. During your stay, you’ll have the option between a catered and self-catered package with a variety of luxurious perks.Just step outside of Chalet Castor’s doors, and you’ll be on your way to another exciting day of skiing on Les Houches. After your day on the mountain, head into downtown Chamonix to spend an evening exploring the vibrant city center, rich with boutique shops, restaurants and bars, and trendy nightclubs. If you’re feeling lucky, head to Casino Chamonix. If you’d rather rest up, there are several spa and wellness centres, or you could sit down for a movie at the cinema.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: This ultra-modern villa is nestled close to the legendary core of one of Europe’s most renowned historical cities; Florence. Drink in a sunset view of the city’s spires from the alfresco dining area, as candles glow and smouldering fire pits light the garden. After a day’s sightseeing, stroll in the herb garden or sip Tuscan wine on the rooftop terrace as stars peek out of the velvety dusk. Dimora Bellosguardo was designed with straight lines and open spaces being prioritized, but with the very best in deep-comfort furnishings and modern technology included as standard. Guests will awake in spacious bedrooms, and can swing massive sun doors to gain direct and easy access to the fragrances of the flower-filled garden. A fully-equipped kitchen is mirrored by a long living room, complete with plush sofa and top-of-the-line TV and sound system. Extras like the rooftop hot tub and charcoal barbecue means guests can relax and socialize with ease, with all the architectural grandeur of this, the birthplace of the Renaissance, in clear view. The villa’s location is one of the major positives. Located just a 15 minute walk from the Basilica di Santo Spirito, the villa offers great access to the beating heart of Florence, with wonders like the Florence Cathedral and the Ponte Vecchio bridge being must-sees. The wider culinary and cultural delights of Tuscany are also there for the taking, with the villa’s location to the south of Florence making a quick escape to the olive groves, hilltop villages and roadside restaurants of Tuscany all too easy. The great square of Sienna and the famous castles and towers of Pisa are great day-trip options located just a little further afield. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Please note: This home is in close proximity to an ongoing construction project. For more information, please contact a Villa Specialist. Gaze out on panoramic vistas of the Saronic Gulf from this majestic, 4-story home at Anavyssos along the Athens Riviera. Perched directly above Paralia Agios Nikolaos Beach, the contemporary villa (built in 2015) offers superb amenities for spa-style relaxation and gourmet festivities, including an indoor hot tub, outdoor pool, and top-of-the-line kitchen. Drive about 25 kilometers to Cape Sounion or 43 kilometers north into the heart of Athens.Multiple terraces and balconies inspire long days and nights in the Aegean breeze. Plunge into the swimming pool (up to 2.7 meters in depth) and bask in the Grecian sun on stylish lounge chairs. Relish a meze platter at the alfresco table, and uncork a bottle of local wine. Kindle the grill at sunset for a barbecue feast of fresh seafood. At night, dip into the pool again for a hydromassage amid the multicolored lighting.The villa’s interiors feature multiple living and dining areas too, with ample room for private downtime or festive gatherings. Try your hand at Greek cuisine in the fully equipped kitchen, and gather for intimate dinners at the table for 6; then cap off the night with a glass of ouzo by the fire. Modern conveniences including an elevator, Wi-Fi, 55-inch TVs, heating, and air conditioning ensure a comfortable stay for all travelers. With 4 deluxe bedrooms suites, Villa Nelmar is ideal for destination wedding guests, family reunions, business retreats, or groups of friends up to 8 in size. Each room includes a king bed and ensuite bathroom, and 2 of the rooms enjoy private balconies with sensational views.The villa enjoys a prime location between Sounion and Athens, surrounded by the myriad treasures of the southern Attic coastline. Alykes is just one of many beaches between here and the famous Temple of Poseidon, the Greek sea god whose worshippers were obviously fond of soul-stirring sunsets. Drive about 40 kilometers north to explore the Acropolis and roam the streets of Plaka and downtown Athens.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: The world’s a stage at this three-story apartment inspired by the great opera houses of Venice, with bespoke furnishings and fittings from floor-length drapes to exquisite floral wallpapers. Terrazzo floors shine under wood-beamed ceilings and warm-hued plaster walls. From its setting in Incurabili, Dorsoduro, it’s a short walk to the banks of the Grand Canal and to vaporetti bound for St. Mark’s. The villa has a Nespresso machine to make mornings brighter, laundry facilities to keep the whole family looking good, and air conditioning to ensure your comfort no matter what the weather in Italy. It also has a cable TV and Wi-Fi to make it easy to stay connected while on holiday. Interior designers Archflorence envisioned this luxury apartment as embodying the spirit of Venice’s opera houses and theaters—and its rooms deliver the drama. From the main entrance on the ground floor, follow the stairs up to a living room and combination dining room and fully equipped kitchen with its own Juliet balcony. Pull back the floor-length drapes for glimpses of Venetian life outside. The four bedrooms at this vacation rental are spread out over the three floors. There are three bedrooms with king beds and private en-suite bathrooms, and one bedroom with two twin beds and a shared hall bathroom. Like the living areas, all four bedrooms are air conditioned. The villa is walking distance from the shores of the Grand Canal, where you can fill your camera with shots of the iconic sweep of the city or board a vaporetto headed for St. Mark’s Square and other must-sees. It’s also close to the pre-19th-century masterpieces in the Gallerie dell’Accademia and the imposing marble facade—and little-known medical museum—in the Scuola Grande di San Marco. Stroll the neighborhood to find a restaurant or bar, or relive your honeymoon on a gondola ride. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Find scenery to impress and decor to enchant at the spectacular Villa Alexandra. Perched on a hillside above the coast in the Taormina area, this Sicily vacation rental commands views over the sea to the horizon. Inside, thoughtfully chosen furnishings and seven suite-style bedrooms give this luxury property magazine-worthy appeal.Your holiday at Villa Alexandra begins with a welcome drink—and will soon start to blur into sunny days spent by the saltwater pool. A terrace with loungers, an outdoor kitchen with a barbecue and an al-fresco dining table makes it easy to enjoy the views during the day, and a TV and Wi-Fi make it easy to relax into the evenings.Inside, the villa has more than 5,000 square feet of beautifully designed living space. Glass walls separate the terrace from a sleek open-concept great room, where you can stretch out on a pair of sectionals, gather around a glass-topped dining table in sculptural chairs or try out local seafood in a fully equipped kitchen with gorgeous stone countertops.There is one bedroom with a king bed and six bedrooms with double beds; all seven bedrooms have private en-suite bathrooms. Together, they can accommodate up to fourteen friends or an equally large group of extended family. Like the great room, the bedrooms are clean and contemporary, with neutral tones and playful accents such as oversized knit throws.The villa’s setting close to Letojanni, a popular resort, puts you just a short drive from the closest shopping and dining and Paradise Beach Club. Practice your serve on the nearby tennis court or take a day trip to the Castiglione di Sicilia golf course. For a quick coffee or a honeymoon-worthy dinner, drive into Taormina, where boutiques, restaurants and cafés fill the town’s historic center.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Reconstructed in traditional Tuscan style, this farmhouse captures the scenic forest and valley views of Casali di Casole. Follow stone walkways connected each living space on this vast property, stopping every-now-and-again to spot a deer or pheasant. Inside, imposing architecture invites unmatched authenticity to your dinner parties. Or, dine at the estate's restaurant, just across the meadow.San Damiano's kitchen is sure to inspire your inner chef with its top-notch appliances, spacious layout, and vibrant backsplash. When the others come to see what you're up to, give them a sneak peek to enjoy at the bistro-set on the balcony. When you're ready, dine under the chandeliers in the formal setting. But first, pick the perfect pairing from the wine cellar.After dinner, let the party spill out to the terrace. Gather at the alfresco set for dessert and a cocktail or 2. When things heat up, turn it into a pool party or embrace San Damiano's relaxing side and move to the hot tub. If you're craving a late-night snack, pizza from the wood-fired oven is always a delicious bet. Then, retire to the master's spa-like ensuite and 4-post bed.Once you've explored the hiking, biking, and horseback trails of the Casali Estate, venture on to Siena and check out the view from Torre del Mangia, the cities highest lookout. Then, make your way to the Uffizi Gallery in Florence to see the works of Giotto, Michelangelo, and Botticelli, to name a few. And, compare your work to that of Mangia Pizza Firenze, one of Florence's best traditional pizza restaurants.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Take in the natural majesty of Naples Bay and Vesuvius beyond from this stunningly-located villa. Perched like a beacon over Sorrento, guests can take in sea breezes and spectacular morning vistas, with the white walls standing out against a blue horizon. Experience the clear pool, comfy and tasteful interiors, plus viewpoint terrace, with Sorrento, Capri and Naples all within a short drive.Awaking in the morning, guests can throw open the sun door and shutter to allow the freshness of Naples Bay to flow through this fine home. Take in an Italian coffee and fresh pastry from the shaded upper terrace, spotting cruising yachts and pleasure craft tracing white wakes through the stunning blue scene below. Guests can lose themselves in the sunlit splendor of the sun recliners, or grill up a storm of local meats and seafood with the supplied barbecue. Meanwhile, the comfortable, clean and unpretentious interiors offer an accommodation experience that is as refreshing as the cool pool that sits alongside the home. The villa’s gardens offer further fine views, while the huge and well-furnished kitchen pairs excellently with the outdoor dining areas.Commanding the high ground outside Sorrento, guests have their pick of this fabled stretch of Italian Coast. To the north, enter the metropolis of Naples, complete with its stunning piazzas, museums and laneways, as well as the dynamic, volcanic slopes of the Vesuvius volcano. Take a cruise off the coast to visited the fabled island of Capri, complete with picture-perfect beaches and reputation as a haunt of Europe’s jetsetters. To the east lies the Amalfi coast, with inlet after inlet of rugged beauty, punctuated by gorgeous seaside towers and villages. From Villa di Nola, guests can take their pick of these famous destinations.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: At the end of a long, winding, and forested road stemming from the village of Mensano, you’ll find this authentic Tuscan farmhouse nestled in peaceful solitude. Capture sweeping hillside-views, valleys of wildflowers, and lush forest from the living room’s glazed-over archway. When you’re ready to explore, visit Montalcino and pick up a bottle or 2 from the world-famous Brunello Vineyard.From the imposing stone archway window to an impressive chef’s kitchen, La Fonte’s great room has everything you could hope for in a social setting. Gather the group at the kitchen’s farm-style island to discuss dinner plans. Then, dine beneath the lights hung from the exposed-wood ceiling. After, sip cocktails in the fireplace lounge before retiring to the masters 4-post bed and spa-like ensuite.The small sitting area by the main window is the perfect spot to catch up on some reading while watching the kids splash around in the pool below. If you’re keeping up with daily life, Smart TV, Wi-Fi, and office space will help. If not, melt any lingering stress away in the hot tub or enjoy an afternoon nap in a sun lounger. Daily housekeeping will keep the villa feeling fresh, and the concierge service is always there to lend a hand.Plan yourself a full day in Florence, Tuscany’s capital, to learn the history, see the sights, and taste everything. Start by snapping a few pics of “David,” Michelangelo’s famous sculpture at Galleria del Accademia. Then, visit Brunelleschi’s Duomo, Giotto’s bell tower, and the incredible collection of art at Uffizi Gallery. For dinner, visit the bustling patio at Nobile Bistro in Piazza Di Madonna Degli Aldobrandini.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Villa Lorenzo is a deluxe villa located between Santa Getrudis and San Lorenzo in the stylish Ibiza area of Spain. This luxury villa is a comfortable and refined choice for those who want the peace and tranquility of the Spanish countryside combined with the option of fabulous activities nearby. The house is set on two acres of land, with beautiful pastoral views of the Church of Santa Eularia and the ocean beyond.The backyard of the house features a huge rectangular swimming pool surrounded by oversized daybeds, loungers and various areas to chill out, in the sun or the shade. There’s even an outdoor kitchen with a gas barbecue, sink and fridge. The villa has a luxurious feel and works well for families, couples or groups. Whether you want a massage on one of the many terraces, to laze in the Bali house while keeping an eye on the children in the magical play area or watch a movie from the extensive library, this villa provides all the perks for a wonderful holiday in Santa Eularia des Riu. At your request, the owners of Villa Lorenzo can even leave their dog, Bonny, to keep guests company—always a big hit with families. Housekeeping and security are included with your reservation.Villa Lorenzo offers a balance of comfort and style with the feeling of a boutique hotel. The architecture and style of the house is fresh and welcoming. The villa has been completely renovated in a style that fuses the contemporary with touches of the Mediterranean and Asia. Many of the furnishings and woodwork have been imported from Bali, with the overall airy and sophisticated feeling in the house. The open plan living, dining and kitchen area opens out onto the gardens and pool area.Five delectable bedrooms accommodate up to eleven guests at Villa Lorenzo. All of the bedrooms include en-suite bathrooms, iPod docks, air conditioning, double or king beds and access either a terrace or a balcony; the master bedroom has sea views as well. An extra room (not air-conditioned) with a single bed off the master bedroom is a perfect spot for kids to sleep. From hanging chairs to a whimsical sea-themed mural in the children’s room, there is something for everyone.At Villa Lorenzo, you will be surrounded by farmland in complete privacy (including an orchard where you can pick your own fruit), but you will also be just minutes from Santa Gertrudis and San Lorenzo with their shops and restaurants. This villa is also a short drive from the Santa Eularia and Ibiza Town. Close to the beach and the fun of Ibiza—a splendid Spanish holiday awaits!Copyright © 2015 Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Look out over the Adriatic Sea and Croatia's neighboring islands from the oceanfront balcony of this sleek villa on Korcula. Lay back in a sun lounger and work on that tan while the kids play beneath the pool's waterfall. On your way into town for dinner, stop off at Prigradica Beach, just 5 minutes away. Then, drive 10 km to the town of Korcula for traditional fish stew and local wine.Stone-clad walls cover all but the ocean-facing side of Villa Palma de Korkyra, leaving you with sweeping views. Each bedroom enjoys an ocean-view as well. When you're in the kitchen, the open concept layout will ensure you never miss a beat in the conversation. After dinner, slide open the patio doors and feel the breeze throughout the stylish interior.Rather dine outside? Fire up the charcoal grill and keep it casual with a backyard barbecue. While you're working on the perfect sear, the kids can bounce on the trampoline. Then, gather around the alfresco set. Now that you've earned a break, rejuvenate in the sauna or jacuzzi, burn off extra energy in the exercise room, or take a nap by the fireplace.Late afternoon is the perfect time of day to take a windsurfing lesson. Schools all around the island offer lessons and equipment rental, and it's all suitable for first-timers. If you'd rather stay dry, take a cycling tour of scenic coastlines, Lumbarda Vineyard, and Old Town. For more ambitious riders, the 25km "Path to Racisce" is an incredibly scenic journey on the way to a historic fishing village.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Capture panoramic city and mountain views from the sunny balcony of this penthouse-ski-lodge in the heart of Zermatt. Warm yourself by the fireplace after a day on the slopes or enjoy the outdoors a little longer and rejuvenate in the hot tub. When you’re ready to hit the town, head down to the streets below and find Michelin-starred restaurants, old-school cocktail bars, and boutique shops.From peaked-ceiling to the warm wood floor, Tschugge mixes modern decor with traditional ski lodge vibes. The open concept layout makes it easy to maintain a social atmosphere even when in separate areas. On nights in, show off your culinary skills in the fully equipped kitchen. After, unleash your inner mixologist and settle into the lounge area by the mountain-view-framing balcony windows.In the warmer months, the rooftop garden is the perfect spot to get some reading done over your morning Nespresso. At night, watch the stars while you warm up around the fire pit. And, the hot tub is a welcoming space any time of the year. On quieter nights, stretch out on the plush sofa in the television lounge and watch a movie with the kids or take a cup of hot chocolate out to the balcony and enjoy the view.Carve up the fresh powder each morning after walking 4 minutes to the Sunnega Express Ski Lift. If you need some inspiration before hitting the slopes, walk 5 minutes to the Matterhorn Museum. When you’re not skiing, enjoy the rugged landscape on the mountain biking trails through the foothills, plan a rock climbing excursion, or charter a fishing trip.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Greet the sunrise over the Aegean Sea from this contemporary villa in Marathon. Situated on a 1,000-square-meter estate near the easternmost edge of the Attic Peninsula, the home is just minutes from several beaches and about 40 kilometers from Athens. Expansive living spaces form an ideal haven for families and large groups of friends, enhanced by an extraordinary collection of original artwork.The villa’s luminous white minimalism alludes to ancient Aegean architecture, accentuating the rich blues of the sky and sea. Dip into the swimming pool and bathe in the sunlight. Grill up fresh seafood and vegetables for a meze platter, and uncork a bottle of local wine in the lounge. Gather for casual afternoon meals at the poolside tables, or a family feast under the veranda. At night, turn on the outdoor lighting to continue the revelry under the stars.Inside, a capacious living room features high ceilings and tufted leather sofas facing a fireplace. The formal dining table is perched on a platform overlooking the living room, flowing gracefully into the chef-grade kitchen. Pluck a volume from the library for a meditative afternoon; retreat into the office suite for an important project; or summon the spirits of the ancient astronomers with the telescope at night.Four bedroom suites with ensuite bathrooms can accommodate families, destination wedding guests, and groups of friends up to 8 in size. The deluxe master suite includes a private lounge with fireplace, while the 3 guestrooms enjoy access to balconies with inspiring views.This tranquil location offers easy access to the peninsula’s rustic beauty, seaside delights, and historical treasures. Beach-lovers will want to visit Schinias, Sessi, and Varnavas, while history buffs will appreciate the Marathon Tomb and the Maraton Archeological Museums. Take the family to the Attica Zoological Park, or drive into Athens for a trip to the Acropolis and dinner in the charming Plaka neighborhood.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Seashell-pink drapes flutter in the breeze at the floor-to-ceiling windows of this ultra modern Sicily retreat. Its two buildings nestle between tree-dotted hillsides sloping gently toward the sea in the distance, which you can see from terraces both sun-splashed and shaded. Explore nature reserves and unspoiled beaches nearby, and drive 10 minutes to Noto to marvel at its 18th-century cathedral. Your holiday starts with a welcome basket of breakfast treats, and can continue in the swimming pool, on a lounger in the sun, with a glass of wine under the pergola, or around the barbecue and al-fresco dining table. For more high-tech entertainment, there’s a satellite TV and Wi-Fi, and for your comfort, there’s air conditioning and a washing machine. On the outside, the crisp angles of this luxury home are broken up by round porthole windows; on the inside, round mirrors and velour textures add softness to the sleek, open-concept great room. Not only is there plenty of seating on tufted sofas and around a dining table for ten, but there are also two fully equipped kitchens. There are three bedrooms in the main house of this vacation rental, all with king beds, en-suite bathrooms, and a private terrace or balcony. There are also two bedrooms in a separate guest house—one with a king bed and en-suite bathroom, and one with a twin sofa bed and hall bathroom—that’s ideal for a family with a younger child or a couple wanting a honeymoon-style escape. The villa’s surroundings are quintessential Italy: snug fishing villages, great seafood restaurants, ruins dotted through the countryside, beautiful beaches, and landmark architecture. Visit a nearby nature reserve known as the Grand Canyon of Italy, sample Nero d’Avola (the local red wine), stroll Loggia Beach, and time your visit to Noto for golden hour, when the setting sun glows against the ornate detail on the city’s baroque buildings. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Take in the dawn light from the rooftop terrace of this hidden and highly sought-after Venetian apartment. Tucked away near the beating heart the city, St Mark’s Square, this comfortable yet compact home includes a lushly-outfitted living room and rich bedrooms complete with birds-eye street views. Guests are just moments from the ornate bridges, gondolas and stunning sights of ancient Venice. Stepping in from the bright sunlight of the street, this apartment provides a shaded, cool and impressively furnished launch-pad for your stay in this storied metropolis. The main living room is a subtle combination of rustic stone and wood featuring, with hand-crafted furniture and rich, soft sofas that are ideal for relaxing after a day walking the historic squares and winding streets of the city below. Take in the morning light with a coffee from the balconies, or kick the day off with breakfast from a local bakery on the converted rooftop terrace, which allows guests to sample the ambience of the day before setting off. After an active afternoon, the refurbished bathroom ensures guests can freshen up in delightful comfort.The star feature of this apartment is the range of options it opens up for guests. Forget Venice’s famously bad traffic, and take a peaceful stroll to local jewels, such as the leafy Royal Gardens, the centuries-old grandeur of St Marco’s Piazza, or the stunning spires and cosmic frescos of the adjacent basilica. With a water taxi hub very close by, guests can quickly sweep out to the stunning scene that is the Grand Canal, taking in a vast number of cathedrals, stately homes and impressive bridges. After an evening dining at one of the fashionable restaurants and Italian restaurants that pepper your home district, a glass of wine on the rooftop terrace serves as a fine way to end a day in one of Europe’s most legendary cities.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Sit back in a sun lounger beneath the shade of a palm tree while you gaze upon sweeping views of the Portopalo seascape at this modern villa in Sicily. Craft the perfectly-decorated pie in the pizza oven while the kids splash around in the pool. Then, gather for dinner at the breezy alfresco set. In the morning, drive 10 minutes to stroll along the sands of the Menfi Beaches.The sleek and stylish architecture uses floor-to-ceiling glass to open Calypso to the beautiful breeze of the countryside. The black-and-white interior gives the villa a classic, elegant feel. Outside, palm trees, sun loungers, and dynamic views remind you the beach is close. Inside, the chef’s kitchen is sure to inspire your culinary side. At dinner, let the wood-burning fireplace add a rustic touch to an unforgettable meal.When the sun has begun to set, unleash our inner mixologist and get creative with a few tropical cocktail recipes, or try Italy’s trademark Bellini. If you’re feeling competitive, organize a pool tournament in the billiards lounge. The losers have to jump in the pool. Later, see if you can find some soccer on the satellite television, and fire up the barbecue for some late-night snacks on the terrace.Make sure to pack your camera if you go the Archaeological site of Selinunte 17 kilometers from home on the way to Castelvetrano. After a few pictures, wander the streets on the nearby village to find ancient architecture, quaint cafes, and bustling patio restaurants. A little closer to home, you’ll find fantastic cycling routes, World-class vineyards and wineries, and white sand beaches in Menfi.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Wake up early to catch the morning sun as it hits the mist in Val d’Orcia, turning the entire valley gold. You’ll have quite the view from this 5-acre hilltop villa 7-minute’s walk from Montalcino’s center. When the mist settles, set out to explore the property’s private vineyard and olive grove. Then, walk into town for breakfast. And, make sure to pick up some Brunello di Montalcino for later. Lovingly-restored, this 1600’s farmhouse has been updated with a state of the kitchen, in-floor heating and cooling, and the highest-end electronics and appliances. Staying true to its roots, Villa La Palazetta also boasts a private cantina and wine cellar, wood-burning pizza oven, and rustic fire pit. Dine outside amongst the mountain views. After dinner, issue a challenge on the night-lit bocce court. Make that home-cooked meal extra-special and get the concierge to book an in-house Italian cooking lesson. The professional kitchen is the perfect place to learn how to hand-make pasta and combine fresh local produce. When the party inevitably moves to the terrace, cool off in the swimming pool, or sample the finest local wines around the alfresco dining set. Rather dine out? Walk into Montalcino and wander within their historic city walls, where high-quality restaurants, bakeries, and gelato shops line the streets. Take a day trip to Siena and explore the museums, galleries, and churches of the ancient Renaissance city. And, wine tours of the World-famous Brunelle Vineyards are a great way to see all the different areas and landscapes of Val d’Orcia.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Retreat to your slice of paradise at this exclusive modern estate in Athens. Large outdoor areas, such as this, are rare in the city, so take advantage and work on your tan, go for a swim, and dine alfresco. When you’re ready to explore, the city centre is just 4 km from home. Or head uphill to the Acropolis of Athens, the city’s 5th-century B.C. temple and museum. Partially divided by a double-sided fireplace, the open concept living area is the perfect setting for a dinner party. Atop earthy hardwood floors, contemporary furniture and high-end electronics add a stylish touch to the decor. Get inspired and make an attempt at traditional Greek cuisine in the state of the art kitchen or grill up some goat on the barbecue outback. After dinner, move the party to the outdoor lounge for cocktails. On quieter nights, stretch out by the fireplace, stream a movie, or catch up on some reading outside by the pool. If you’re keeping up with a fitness routine, the gym on the lower level has free weights, machines, and aerobic equipment. And, despite its downtown location, Urban Villa has garage parking for 6 and an elevator to help with any accessibility issues.Athens is home to Greece’s National Archaeological Museum, which happens to be one of the world’s largest, and richest, collections of exhibits and artifacts. After a morning of discovery, head to the winding 19th-century streets of Plaka for a gyro. This bustling area is packed with family-run shops and incredible Greek food stands. At night, do some bar hopping in the Exarchia neighborhood. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: The traditional charm of beamed ceilings and stone walls fits seamlessly with state-of-the-art details at this modern recreation of an Italian farmhouse. While it’s surrounded by the cypress trees and vineyards of the quintessential Tuscan landscape, it also has an open-concept layout not found in historic homes. Pick up produce in the hill town of Casole d’Elsa and day-trip to Siena and Florence.Spot field, forest, and distant hills from outdoor living areas with a swimming pool, sitting areas, a row of loungers in the sunshine, and alfresco dining under a pergola. Serve dinner from the barbecue and pizza oven, or step inside to watch a show on the smart TV and share holiday updates via Wi-Fi.Stone arches, wood-beamed ceilings and a large hearth hearken back to the past in the living room of this vacation rental, where 3 sitting areas make it easy to catch up with friends and family. By contrast, a wall of windows lines one side of the open-concept dining area and fully equipped kitchen, which is laid out around a gleaming blue and brass range.This luxury property has 3 bedrooms with king beds, including one that opens to a terrace, and 1 bedroom with 2 queen beds. All 4 bedrooms have private ensuite bathrooms, air conditioning and, like the main living areas, plenty of traditional style, whether in the form of a four-poster bed, wood floors, or windows with painted shutters.With concierge service included in your stay, it’s easy to make the most of your time in Italy. Book a cooking or wine-tasting class, take a bicycle or horseback ride through the landscape, reserve a tee time at a nearby golf course, or take a honeymoon from the everyday at a spa. If you’re keen to explore, plan day trips to the cities of Siena and Florence.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Swim in the ocean at Praia do Pego and return on foot to alfresco meals and poolside relaxation at this modernist gem. Featuring unique architectural design and a superb collection of artefacts from around the world, this private home offers a unique experience of one of Portugal’s best-kept secrets: Comporta and the superb beaches stretching to its south. Secluded on a lush and ample estate, the villa harmonizes gracefully with the seaside landscape. Luminous interiors flow out to multiple patios and decks, including a swimming pool surrounded by sun-kissed lounge chairs. Utilize the gourmet kitchen and outdoor grill to conjure up traditional Portuguese feasts, and savor a bottle of local wine on the rooftop terrace with views of the ocean and Arrábida National Park. The unique decor pays homage to the country’s maritime character and adventurous spirit, with objects hailing from Bali, Brazil, North Africa, Mexico, and beyond.Although situated just south of Lisbon, Comporta has maintained a pristine, off-the-beaten path character, with well-protected beaches and large private estates. This combination has proved attractive to certain famous and well-heeled travelers seeking utter tranquility and some of the finest beaches and restaurants in Europe. In addition to Pego Beach down the road, the villa is a short drive from family-friendly Carvalhal Beach. Among the top-flight restaurants in Comporta town, the must-try spot for traditional fare is the Museu do Arroz.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Glimpse the Tuscany of the past in the pastoral surroundings and graceful 19th-century architecture of Villa Controni. Formerly the summer residence of the Contronis, a noble merchant family, this well-preserved vacation rental now welcomes parties of up to twenty-two guests to its tranquil setting outside Lucca. Though the villa was once a working estate, today it’s the perfect place to host a family reunion or even an intimate Italian wedding with pine forests and castle-dotted hilltops as a backdrop.Your holiday at Villa Controni includes chef service at breakfast and lunch or dinner. Spend your stay taking in the views across the olive groves to the Nottolini aqueduct, breathing in the scent of the flowers in the walled garden, stretching out on a lounger by the pool or trying out local specialties from the barbecue at the al-fresco dining area. Inside, amenities like a fitness center, games room and wine fridge make it easy to relax or entertain. The property even has a private chapel that can be used for weddings.The interiors of this luxury property revel in its Old World heritage, from the glittering chandeliers and plush area rugs to the brightly painted paneling that lines the sitting and dining rooms. A quiet study shows the same elegance on a smaller scale, while the fully equipped kitchen is large enough to cater for a crowd. Despite the villa’s history, it has modern features from Wi-Fi and air conditioning to satellite television as well.Each of the villa’s eleven sumptuous bedrooms has an en-suite bathroom; ten of them have double beds and one offers the choice of a queen bed or two twin beds. You’ll be enchanted both by the suites’ stone floors and traditional furnishings, and the sweeping views of the countryside out the windows.Villa Controni is less than 5 miles from Lucca and a tennis club, and less than 20 miles from Pisa and a golf course. Spend a day in Lucca for to admire its palazzos and churches and look out from the famous tree-topped Guinigi Tower, or drive into Pisa for a photo op and a romantic, honeymoon-style stroll along the river where luminaries from Galileo to Fibonacci have walked.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Situated on one of the city’s most beautiful streets, in one of the world’s most beautiful cities, this two-bedroom apartment enjoys an extremely prestigious and convenient location in bustling downtown London, England. From your rooftop terrace, you’ll have an incredible view of St. James Palace, and Historic St. James Street, which is famous for its stately architecture, boutique shops, and fine dining establishments. Perfect for a family vacation, honeymoon, or business trip, Palace View Penthouse celebrates London in style.Just like St. James Street below, this penthouse is adorned with classic and sophisticated finishes. Hardwood flooring, designer furniture, and high-end electronics fill the Palace View Penthouse interior. If a wall isn’t displaying an eclectic work of art, it must be because it is showing off, yet another, scenic view of the historic street and palace just outside. On the balcony, you’ll find a delightful little alfresco set, the perfect spot to enjoy your morning tea before another exciting day in London.Palace View Penthouse features a fully equipped kitchen, decorated with state of the art appliances and sleek cabinetry. There’s a formal dining area, perfect for hosting friends and colleagues, with seating for eight. And, both bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms; the master features a sitting area with a scenic view of St. James Street.London is a great walking city, especially in this bustling area, so forget about guidebooks, the city will show you around. Within a two-mile radius, you’ll find Piccadilly Circus, Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, Hyde Park, Westminster Abbey, and the London Eye. You’ll have no trouble finding shopping, dining, and nightlife options in central London, and the bars and pubs are the finest on the planet. If you’re feeling like cooking at home or you’d like to sample a wide variety of high-end street foods, Borough Market is always a great spot to enjoy vibrant atmosphere and finely crafted foods.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Traditional architecture and modern decor are the perfect pairing at the enchanting Can Paola. Modeled on the classic fincas of Spain, this private Ibiza vacation rental is set on more than seven acres in the countryside outside San Jose. Its nearly 4,000 square feet of living space and five bedrooms, however, can welcome groups of up to ten friends or family members in contemporary luxury.The views from Can Paola stretch from the property's own lush gardens to the surrounding hillsides all the way to the sea. Take in the vistas from gorgeous outdoor living areas with a pool, lounging and dining areas, a barbecue and a tennis court. After sunset, continue the games indoors over the ping-pong table or unwind with the help of the sound system and Wi-Fi.While the villa's interiors are open plan, with one room flowing into the next, there are also plenty of quiet nooks where you can catch up on reading or steal a nap. Traditional details such as beamed ceilings, stone walls, terracotta floors and an open-hearth fireplace lend charm in the living and dining rooms, while a wide sliding door lets you open the spaces to the sunny terrace outside. The fully equipped kitchen is all modern, with stainless steel appliances and bold artwork.There are two bedrooms in the main house at Can Paola; both have king beds, one has an en-suite bathroom and the other has access to a hall bathroom. The other three bedrooms-two of which have king beds and one of which has two twin beds-have en-suite bathrooms and exterior access, making them perfect for use as a honeymoon-style retreat or a separate haven for in-laws.While Can Paola feels like its own rural idyll, it's only a short drive from oceanfront dining in the town of Sant Josep de sa Talaia and several beaches, including lively Es Torrent and scenic Cala Jondal. No holiday on the island is complete without a visit to Ibiza Town, whether for its historic buildings or its famed nightlife.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Perched on a west-facing hillside just outside of Sant Antoni de Portmany and Ibiza Town, Can Juana is a luxuriously appointed vacation home that was designed to capture incredible sunsets and countryside views. With privacy provided by lush greenery, this breezy six-bedroom is the perfect host for a family vacation or an exciting getaway with a group of friends. There are several pristine beachfront areas just minutes from Can Juana, as well as the village of San Jose, where you'll find boutique shops, cafes, markets, and authentic Spanish cuisine.Designed to embrace the natural environment, Can Juana has incorporated wood, stone, and local flora into its open-concept interior. With large openings to the terrace, the free-flowing atmosphere is felt throughout the entire indoor space. Designer furniture, high tech electronics, and eclectic works of art decorate the calming interior, creating a relaxing, yet elegant space to enjoy an amazing vacation.At dinner, you'll love the formal dining area inside, but if you can't tear yourself away from the beautiful weather, there's an alfresco set on the terrace. Also on the terrace, there's a beautiful swimming pool with sun loungers and outdoor living areas spread throughout the sunny space. In the main house, there are four king en-suite bedrooms, and two more bedrooms in the guest suite, which features a separate entrance and a kitchenette.Well known as the nightlife capital of the world, the Island of Ibiza is infamous for its beachfront bars, dance clubs, and exciting year-round festivities. Sant Antoni and Ibiza Town are the two main cities on the island. There's some debate over which is the more famous party destination. With both being around fifteen-kilometers from Can Juana, you'll be in the perfect position to decide for yourself. If you feel like something a little more low-key, head for Old Town Ibiza where you can enjoy breathtaking architecture, art galleries, cafes, and fine dining.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: As its name would suggest, this stunning vacation rental perfectly captures the silhouette of the most iconic of all Paris’ landmarks. The two bedroom Tour Eiffel in Trocadero will surely delight both young and old from sunrise right through nightfall, when the “iron lady” sparkles in the midnight blue sky. The Eiffel Tower seems so close from this apartment that you almost get the impression it is shining just for you!This chic and intimate luxury accommodation is located in a splendid Haussmann-style, cut-stone building. In the ideal setting for a discreet and romantic getaway to stylish Trocadero, even the housekeeper will be virtually invisible while serving each morning’s personalized breakfast. Guests of Tour Eiffel will receive complimentary access to all the hotel services of La Réserve de Paris, a five-star hotel and spa that will make daily life even more magical. Facilities include a swimming pool, fitness center, steam room and library.The interiors are quite spacious for a private apartment located in the heart of Paris. The furnishings are contemporary with a pleasing monochromatic palette. The open plan great room features a living room with a sectional couch, a dining area and a kitchen with a serving bar. Modern artworks reflect the avant-garde spirit of the City of Light.Two bedrooms accommodate up to four guests at this non-smoking apartment. Both bedrooms provide queen size beds, en-suite bathrooms and televisions. One of the suites also has a rain shower and a balneotherapy tub. Fine linens and accoutrements provide splendid nights of rest amid the hushed frequencies of the city. We recommend Tour Eiffel for a family getaway, a couples’ retreat or a decadent honeymoon in this unrivaled cultural destination.Guests of Tour Eiffel will enjoy the services of a full, professional staff. Daily housekeeping, butler service, daily breakfasts, a welcome package, daily afternoon tea times, laundry service and valet service are all included with your holiday reservation. Sportive guests will also love use of the bicycles and complimentary access to the Roland Garros Tennis Courts, home of the French Open. Paris never looked so good!Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Craft the perfect pie in the outdoor pizza oven while you gaze upon the rolling hillside of Tuscany at this fairy-tale farmhouse in Casole d’ Elsa. Awaken each morning to fresh country-air, fragrant gardens, and a feeling of peaceful solitude. After a family meal at the breakfast table in the chef’s kitchen, discuss sightseeing plans. Then, head out to discover Siena, Florence, and Montalcino.From the peaks of the exposed-wood ceiling to the stone-tiled floors, Pietti is a true testament to authentic Tuscan architecture. Decorated with stately furniture, four-post beds, and chandelier lighting, you’ll feel like you’ve stepped back to simpler, elegant times. Stone archways link each room and lead outside to the scenic terrace, where you can stretch out in a sun lounger beside the refreshing pool.Before dinner, pick the perfect pairing for your meal in the wine cellar. After, set the kids up with a movie in the upstairs family room. Then, throw a log on the fire, mix up a couple of bellinis, and sink into the plush sofa while chatting with old friends. Later in the night, move the party to the terrace lounge or hop into the hot tub. Daily housekeeping will refresh the villa in the morning.The nearest town, Siena, dates back to the Etruscan era with most of its growth taking place in the Middle-Ages. Today, Siena has one of the most intriguing skylines in the country. On your approach, you’ll see Torre del Mangia, the town’s highest lookout tower. The view from the top is well worth the journey, and the pictures are unbeatable. After, treat yourself to dinner at Gordon Ramsey’s Castel Monastero.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Ermal is an enchanting villa in the Apulia (Puglia) region of Southern Italy, situated between Ostuni and Brindisi, within minutes of Lido Bianco Beach and the town of Carovigno. The modern home offers a graceful balance of high-end comforts and traditional Puglian charm, emphasizing the pleasures of open-air living. Ample outdoor spaces include a beautiful pool terrace with inset spa, a shaded loggia, and a generous patio with alfresco dining for twelve. Air conditioning, an alarm system, Wi-Fi, and excellent media features create a comfortable environment for all guests, while the luminous kitchen will inspire the gourmet traveler. Five superb bedroom suites with ensuite bathrooms—including two separate guest houses—welcome families and groups of friends up to ten in size.The Adriatic Sea is visible on the horizon, bathing the estate in dreamy breezes. Enjoy sunny days on the terrace, soaking in the hot tub and plunging into the refreshing pool. Bask in the light on lounge chairs and savor cool drinks in the shaded loggia. Fire up the barbecue in the afternoon, and gather for delicious meals on the spacious patio. Linger outdoors in the evening, sipping glasses of Puglian wine under the starry sky.The kitchen is the home's heart, featuring chef-grade appliances, a breakfast bar for five, and large glass doors opening to the alfresco table. Lovely lighting and accents of wood and bamboo create a welcoming, natural atmosphere. The living room offers a comfortable retreat, with thick-cushioned sofas and a cool, soothing palette of grays and blues.There are three king bedroom suites in the main house, each with an ensuite bathroom. The guesthouses offer extra seclusion, with queen beds, lounge areas, ensuite bathrooms, and private entrances from the gardens. All of the bedrooms have air-conditioning and TVs. These arrangements are ideal for destination wedding guests or corporate retreats.Apulia is a relatively untrodden paradise of Southern Italy, with extraordinary beaches and vineyards and a distinctive culture manifesting in its fabulous cuisine and traditional architecture. The famous "white city" of Ostuni is twenty kilometers away, set amidst the enchanting Itria Valley—famous for its cone-shaped trulli houses. The beaches of Lido Bianco and Torre Guaceto (a pristine nature reserve with a 16th-century tower) are also within easy reach.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Experience living in the pleasant surrounds of Queen’s Park with this fully refurbished and colorfully-outfitted terrace home. A combination of classic layout and Edwardian influences blends with modern fixtures and stylistic touches. A sunny, flower-filled garden fills the view from the kitchen, with Central London nicely close by.Balanced style is present in abundance in each room of this home, from the inventive lighting that rises alongside the polished stone and rich wooden walls of the kitchen, to the rich, blackened chairs that guests will appreciate settling into at mealtime. Useful and effective clothing storage is present in the comfortable bedrooms, which come with their own distinct personalities and attractive fixtures. A suntrap terrace ensures guests always have a great hang-out spot when the sun shines, which is lined with leafy plants and squishy cushions. Located in a classically English terrace home, entering and leaving the home is always simple and direct.Queen’s Park is the ideal neighborhood from which to experience the best that London has to offer. Just a short drive, or trip by tube (subway) will bring guests to famous locations including the leafy pathways of Kensington Gardens, the grand entrance of Buckingham Palace, and the eagle-eye view of the London Eye ferris wheel. With a galaxy of restaurants and shopping outlets available for all tastes, local options include dozens of welcoming pubs and historic sports grounds, including the soccer hub of Loftus Road.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.For guests travelling in the warmer months, please note that air conditioning is not available at this property.

listing.listing_description: Located in the heart of Menaggio, Italy, this villa takes luxury to the next level. Pop art hangs on the intricately decorated walls while herringbone floors flow throughout. The fireside living room takes centre stage when stepping into the first floor of the Palazzo—a renovated, historic building constructed in 1731. Spend the day on Lake Como or sauntering through the picturesque town centre.Antique and modern décor seamlessly come together, popping against original frescos, to create a unique, quintessentially Italian atmosphere. An antique library table hosts up to 8 for dinner. Have your whole crew join together in the sitting area where a plush selection of furniture awaits to kick back and converse on. The light, airy den features painted wood ceilings and a tranquil space to curl up with a book or stream your favourite show. Stroll through your private garden to get to the condo’s communal area as well as the shared swimming pool. The Juliette balcony off the kitchen is a quiet place to sip your morning espresso. Hop on the ferry to explore nearby Bellagio, Cadenabbia, or Varenna. Your choice of golf clubs are within driving distance and the Menaggio Tennis Club is a short 5-minute walk away. Cycle along the panoramic promenade or through a variety of routes spanning hundreds of kilometers around the lake. Hiking through the surrounding hilltops will offer a photo ready, bird’s eye perspective of the quaint town below.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: It’s all in the name of Chalet Dolce Vita. The private spa, attentive staff and custom finishes at this luxury Veneto vacation rental give up to eight guests a taste of the good life. Visit during the winter to experience the ski slopes that once hosted the Winter Olympics, or during the summer to explore the museums, churches and more in the historic Cortina region.Your holiday at the chalet includes the services of a butler, driver and housekeeper. The property is designed to be both practical and pampering, with amenities like heated ski storage and an elevator along with a spa area that features a hot tub, sauna, gym, indoor pool and more. Whether you’ve spent the day skiing or sightseeing, a wood fireplace, games room and home theater make it easy to spend the evening relaxing or entertaining.The villa’s four levels offer more than 8,000 square feet of living space and are connected by an elevator. Though traditional on the outside, with a peaked roof and overhanging eaves, Chalet Dolce Vita is cozy and modern on the inside. Warm wood floors form the backdrop for contemporary pieces like tuxedo-style sectionals, Lucite accent tables and sleek fireplace surrounds. An open-plan living room with a wet bar, formal dining area and fully equipped kitchen let you host a casual soiree or elegant dinner.All four of the chalet’s bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms with jetted tubs and their own lounge areas, and most of them open to balconies. The honeymoon-worthy master suite has a king bed and two en-suites, as well as a fireplace that invites snuggling up. There are two bedrooms with queen beds, and one bedroom with bunk beds that gives kids a space all their own and makes this villa perfect for a family trip.Chalet Dolce Vita is no more than a 10-minute walk from two different ski lifts, and no more than a 10-minute drive from three other lifts. It’s also a short walk from central Cortina, which has shopping, dining, traditional churches and even a modern art museum. Other must-sees in the area are a paleontology museum with fascinating exhibits on Dolomite fossils, and the Forte Tre Sassi, an imposing Alpine fortress.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Water falling from the vertical garden into the courtyard swimming pool sets a soothing tone at this ultra-modern home in Lisbon’s fashion district. Catch up on a little reading in the library. Stretch out next to the wood-burning fireplace. And, explore the loft’s extensive collection of contemporary art. If you’re feeling inspired, set out to find nearby art galleries and lovely bistros.The classic combination of pure-white and lightly toned wood never fails to create a relaxing atmosphere, and Loft 58 is the perfect place to escape the bustling city. Clear sight-lines and floor-to-ceiling windows give the loft an airy, Bohemian feel. Follow the wood floors to each room, proudly displaying thoughtfully selected art. In the ensuites, you’ll love the rich marble and high-end fixtures. The kitchen is sure to awaken your inner chef, maybe even try your hand at some traditional Portuguese dishes.Portugal is known for its blue-tile art called azulejos, which is always on display at the National Museum, 6-minutes from home. After a morning at the museum, visit Alfama and wander the city’s oldest neighborhood, following winding streets lined with small cafes, delicious bakeries, and tapas restaurants. Then, set out to snap a few pictures at the Tower of Belem, Jeronimos Monastery, and Castelo de S. Jorge. At night, Barrio Alto is the nightlife district, with dozens of trendy bars on cobblestone streets.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Creamy stone turns warm and inviting in the Puglia sunshine bathing this lovingly restored masseria. Surrounded by centuries-old olive groves, this farmhouse still has the remnants of presses built into rock walls, but modern furnishings breathe new life into its traditional vaulted-ceiling rooms. It’s a short drive to Ostuni, a hilltop town known as the White City for its pearl-like buildings.Stone walls and tall hedges make the villa’s grounds quiet and private. Catch up on reading in a lounger in the sun, cool off in the swimming pool, sit down for aperitivo beneath the pergola, and pick up market-fresh produce to toss on the barbecue and serve at the alfresco table for 8. While the home’s ancient mill dates back centuries, it also has state-of-the-art technology such as an integrated sound system and Wi-Fi.Step through French doors from the terrace into the long open-concept great room at this vacation rental, whose stone floors and arched ceilings come to life in the sunshine. There’s a sitting area with a generous sectional, a dining table for 6, and a fully equipped kitchen with colorful tile and an inviting breakfast table.This luxury property has 3 bedrooms with double beds, including a master suite with its own balcony, and 1 bedroom with a queen bed. All 4 bedrooms have ensuite bathrooms and air conditioning to keep you comfortable during summer in Italy.The town nearest the villa is Ostuni, a hilltop enclave whose architecture dates back to medieval times. Stroll its maze-like streets, pausing to sample local olive oil—or gelato, if you’re on holiday with the whole family—have a glass of wine, or sit down to a honeymoon-worthy dinner featuring seafood from the nearby coast. For a memorable day trip, see the sea in Polignano a Mare or explore the Grotte di Castellana caves.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Like a living museum, this elegant apartment in Lisbon tells a story with its collection of fine art. Follow hardwood floors to discover thoughtfully curated designer furnishings, ornate lighting, and breathtaking azulejo tiling. Step outside to the courtyard to sip your morning tea. Then, walk 9 minutes to Alfama, one of Portugal’s oldest areas, for breakfast in a small cafe or bakery.Beneath chandelier lights, Casa dell’Arte Club House’s stately living room is the perfect place to celebrate a special occasion. Before dinner in the azulejo-tiled dining room, enjoy a cocktail while you discuss your favorite pieces of art. Bring in a private chef to prepare a menu of traditional Portuguese favorites in the fully-equipped kitchen. After dinner, move the party to the courtyard for one more glass of wine. Then, retire to one of the themed bedrooms, all with king-sized beds and lavish ensuites.Wake up early to dig your feet into the sand along the shore of Cascais Beach. Once the sun has risen and the shops have opened, treat yourself to breakfast at a beachside cafe. Then, visit some of Lisbon’s most important historical sites, Rossio Square, Castelo de S. Jorge, and the Tower of Belem. For lunch, seafood lovers will need to visit the waterfront district, Cais do Sodre, for the city’s hippest tapas restaurants. And at night, Barrio Alto is the spot for bar hopping.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Casa Jardin (“Garden House”) is situated in the countryside near Ibiza Town, minutes from Playa d'en Bossa. The estate is brimming with lush, beautifully landscaped gardens and orchards that create an ambiance of vibrant serenity. Ideal for special occasions or relaxing escapes, the expansive grounds feature a large swimming pool, a well-equipped outdoor kitchen, an ample lawn, and a wraparound terrace with panoramic views of the coastline and sea. The villa's six superb bedroom suites are distributed throughout the main house, gardens, and courtyard, offering well-appointed privacy for up to twelve guests.The villa blends gracefully into the natural surroundings, with beautiful stone walls evoking the island's rustic character, and lovely vines gracing the open-air patios. Step into the voluminous swimming pool for a soothing soak, and bask in the sunlight on stylish lounge chairs. Prepare delicious meals in the outdoor kitchen, and relish them alfresco at the sea-view table. Sip drinks in the shaded lounges on the patio, and linger outdoors deep into the evening, admiring starry sky over the Mediterranean.A vanishing wall joins the patio with the interior, inviting the sea-scented air into the home. On cooler nights, close the doors and kindle the fireplace as you uncork a bottle of Spanish wine. The gourmet kitchen is fully equipped and features sleek surfaces, chef-grade appliances, and a breakfast bar. Air conditioning and a security system keep you comfortable at all times.The villa features two suites with king beds, three with queen beds, and one with two twin-size beds. All enjoy ensuite bathrooms. The master suite has a private terrace, walk-in closet, and dressing area, and its bathroom boasts a dual vanity, top-of-the-line shower, and lovely soaking tub. The arrangement of the suites offers a comfortable haven for families or destination wedding guests.Casa Jardin balances seclusion and convenience on this unique island, as renowned for its beauty as for its incomparable nightlife. You're just eight kilometers from Ibiza Town and Sant Josep de sa Talaia, and within easy reach of the beaches at Talamanca and Playa d'en Bossa. The international airport is just four kilometers away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
